content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

You can achieve this by using the `startswith` method in Julia which checks if the string starts with the specified prefix. Here is how you can write the function:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    new_list = [word for word in words if startswith(word, uppercase(first(word)))]
    return new_list
end
```
This function uses a list comprehension to iterate over the provided list of words and constructs a new list that only includes words that start with an uppercase letter. The `startswith` method in Julia checks if a string starts with the specified prefix, so we pass the uppercased first character of each word as the prefix to check if it is the starting letter of any word.

Note: In case you want to check for lowercase letters at the start also then you would need to modify this function accordingly.
